intro: Argophyllum obovatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed argophyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant features glossy, oval-shaped leaves that are often arranged in pairs along the stems. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Argophyllum obovatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
